subject: Law
title: The Supremacy Clause
description: A quick win: understand The Supremacy Clause.

hook.text: A state tried to tax a federal bank in 1819. The Supreme Court said noâ€”and defined federal supremacy.

buildup.text: Article VI declares the Constitution and federal laws the 'supreme Law of the Land.'

discovery.text: In McCulloch v. Maryland, Chief Justice Marshall ruled that states cannot interfere with federal operations.

twist.text: Supremacy doesn't mean unlimited federal power. Congress must act within its enumerated powers first.

climax.text: When federal and state laws collide, courts use preemption doctrine to decide which survives.

punchline.text: Federal law is supremeâ€”but only where the Constitution lets it reach.
